intro: Thysanocarpus curvipes subsp. curvipes, commonly known as the slender thysanocarpus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It produces distinctive fruits known as capsules, which contain several seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
